2003.quote: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.
2003.author: Bertrand Russell

2004.quote: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
2004.author: Benjamin Franklin

2005.quote: The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.
2005.author: Albert Einstein

2006.quote: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
2006.author: Audrey Hepburn

2007.quote: I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death.
2007.author: Robert Fulghum

2008.quote: A people without the knowledge of their past history, origin and culture is like a tree without roots.
2008.author: Marcus Garvey

2009.quote: The only source of knowledge is experience.
2009.author: Albert Einstein

2010.quote: Knowledge is power. Information is liberating. Education is the premise of progress, in every society, in every family.
2010.author: Kofi Annan

2011.quote: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
2011.author: Benjamin Franklin

2012.quote: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
2012.author: Confucius

2013.quote: Never stop fighting until you arrive at your destined place - that is, the unique you. Have an aim in life, continuously acquire knowledge, work hard, and have perseverance to realise the great life.
2013.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

2014.quote: The great aim of education is not knowledge but action.
2014.author: Herbert Spencer

2015.quote: Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.
2015.author: Carl Sagan

2016.quote: To know what you know and what you do not know, that is true knowledge.
2016.author: Confucius

2017.quote: Ignorance is the curse of God; knowledge is the wing wherewith we fly to heaven.
2017.author: William Shakespeare

2018.quote: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
2018.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

2019.quote: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
2019.author: Albert Einstein

2020.quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of facts within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.
2020.author: Calvin Coolidge

2021.quote: Science knows no country, because knowledge belongs to humanity, and is the torch which illuminates the world. Science is the highest personification of the nation because that nation will remain the first which carries the furthest the works of thought and intelligence.
2021.author: Louis Pasteur

2022.quote: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.
2022.author: Plato

2023.quote: Knowledge will forever govern ignorance; and a people who mean to be their own governors must arm themselves with the power which knowledge gives.
2023.author: James Madison

2024.quote: Love is a really scary thing, and you never know what's going to happen. It's one of the most beautiful things in life, but it's one of the most terrifying. It's worth the fear because you have more knowledge, experience, you learn from people, and you have memories.
2024.author: Ariana Grande

2026.quote: A good decision is based on knowledge and not on numbers.
2026.author: Plato

2027.quote: The one exclusive sign of thorough knowledge is the power of teaching.
2027.author: Aristotle

2028.quote: The aim of education is the knowledge, not of facts, but of values.
2028.author: William S. Burroughs

2029.quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
2029.author: Immanuel Kant

2030.quote: Knowledge will give you power, but character respect.
2030.author: Bruce Lee

2031.quote: There are three principal means of acquiring knowledge... observation of nature, reflection, and experimentation. Observation collects facts; reflection combines them; experimentation verifies the result of that combination.
2031.author: Denis Diderot

2032.quote: It is beyond a doubt that all our knowledge begins with experience.
2032.author: Immanuel Kant

2033.quote: Carry out a random act of kindness, with no expectation of reward, safe in the knowledge that one day someone might do the same for you.
2033.author: Princess Diana

2034.quote: To know, is to know that you know nothing. That is the meaning of true knowledge.
2034.author: Socrates

2035.quote: Wonder rather than doubt is the root of all knowledge.
2035.author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

2036.quote: The only fence against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.
2036.author: John Locke

2037.quote: Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.
2037.author: Warren Buffett

2038.quote: I know of no time in human history where ignorance was better than knowledge.
2038.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

2039.quote: Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal, and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom.
2039.author: Charles Spurgeon

2040.quote: Opinion is the medium between knowledge and ignorance.
2040.author: Plato

2041.quote: For the things of this world cannot be made known without a knowledge of mathematics.
2041.author: Roger Bacon

2043.quote: The best advice I ever got was that knowledge is power and to keep reading.
2043.author: David Bailey

2044.quote: The goal of education is not to increase the amount of knowledge but to create the possibilities for a child to invent and discover, to create men who are capable of doing new things.
2044.author: Jean Piaget

2045.quote: Intelligence, knowledge or experience are important and might get you a job, but strong communication skills are what will get you promoted.
2045.author: Mireille Guiliano

2046.quote: Those who have knowledge, don't predict. Those who predict, don't have knowledge.
2046.author: Lao Tzu

2047.quote: Knowledge is power. Information is power. The secreting or hoarding of knowledge or information may be an act of tyranny camouflaged as humility.
2047.author: Robin Morgan

2048.quote: The improvement of understanding is for two ends: first, our own increase of knowledge; secondly, to enable us to deliver that knowledge to others.
2048.author: John Locke

2049.quote: When people rely on surface appearances and false racial stereotypes, rather than in-depth knowledge of others at the level of the heart, mind and spirit, their ability to assess and understand people accurately is compromised.
2049.author: James A. Forbes

2050.quote: Happiness exists on earth, and it is won through prudent exercise of reason, knowledge of the harmony of the universe, and constant practice of generosity.
2050.author: Jose Marti

2052.quote: Don't only practice your art, but force your way into its secrets; art deserves that, for it and knowledge can raise man to the Divine.
2052.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

2053.quote: Some people drink from the fountain of knowledge, others just gargle.
2053.author: Robert Anthony

2054.quote: If education is always to be conceived along the same antiquated lines of a mere transmission of knowledge, there is little to be hoped from it in the bettering of man's future. For what is the use of transmitting knowledge if the individual's total development lags behind?
2054.author: Maria Montessori

2055.quote: The control of information is something the elite always does, particularly in a despotic form of government. Information, knowledge, is power. If you can control information, you can control people.
2055.author: Tom Clancy

2056.quote: A thorough knowledge of the Bible is worth more than a college education.
2056.author: Theodore Roosevelt

2057.quote: We cannot stop natural disasters but we can arm ourselves with knowledge: so many lives wouldn't have to be lost if there was enough disaster preparedness.
2057.author: Petra Nemcova

2058.quote: Our knowledge and all of our ideas are mutually connected; the more complicated they are, the more numerous must be the roads that lead to them and depart from them.
2058.author: Cesare Beccaria

2059.quote: Three passions, simple but overwhelmingly strong, have governed my life: the longing for love, the search for knowledge, and unbearable pity for the suffering of mankind.
2059.author: Bertrand Russell

2060.quote: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
2060.author: Isaac Asimov

2061.quote: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
2061.author: Socrates

2062.quote: You are the master of your own ship, pal. There are lots of people who fall into troubled waters and don't have the guts or the knowledge or the ability to make it to shore. They have nobody to blame but themselves.
2062.author: Evel Knievel

2063.quote: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.
2063.author: Margaret Fuller

2064.quote: When knowledge is limited - it leads to folly... When knowledge exceeds a certain limit, it leads to exploitation.
2064.author: Abu Bakr

2065.quote: Knowledge is love and light and vision.
2065.author: Helen Keller

2066.quote: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
2066.author: Marilyn vos Savant

2067.quote: Knowledge has to be improved, challenged, and increased constantly, or it vanishes.
2067.author: Peter Drucker

2068.quote: The larger the island of knowledge, the longer the shoreline of wonder.
2068.author: Ralph W. Sockman

2069.quote: The gift of fantasy has meant more to me than my talent for absorbing positive knowledge.
2069.author: Albert Einstein

2070.quote: The more knowledge you have, the greater will be your fear of Allah.
2070.author: Abu Bakr

2071.quote: It is not knowledge, but the act of learning, not possession but the act of getting there, which grants the greatest enjoyment.
2071.author: Carl Friedrich Gauss

2072.quote: Liberty cannot be preserved without general knowledge among the people.
2072.author: John Adams

2073.quote: The interpretation of dreams is the royal road to a knowledge of the unconscious activities of the mind.
2073.author: Sigmund Freud

2074.quote: The art and science of asking questions is the source of all knowledge.
2074.author: Thomas Berger

2075.quote: There is, however, another purpose to which academies contribute. When they consist of a limited number of persons, eminent for their knowledge, it becomes an object of ambition to be admitted on their list.
2075.author: Charles Babbage

2076.quote: Despite my firm convictions, I have always been a man who tries to face facts, and to accept the reality of life as new experience and new knowledge unfolds. I have always kept an open mind, a flexibility that must go hand in hand with every form of the intelligent search for truth.
2076.author: Malcolm X

2077.quote: Your competition is not other people but the time you kill, the ill will you create, the knowledge you neglect to learn, the connections you fail to build, the health you sacrifice along the path, your inability to generate ideas, the people around you who don't support and love your efforts, and whatever god you curse for your bad luck.
2077.author: James Altucher

2078.quote: The modern mind is in complete disarray. Knowledge has stretched itself to the point where neither the world nor our intelligence can find any foot-hold. It is a fact that we are suffering from nihilism.
2078.author: Albert Camus

2080.quote: Life is a travelling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.
2080.author: D. H. Lawrence

2081.quote: A little knowledge that acts is worth infinitely more than much knowledge that is idle.
2081.author: Khalil Gibran

2082.quote: We believe... that by encouraging critical thinking and processing of knowledge we are creating full, well-rounded human beings... that will enable Qatar to build up its society. You cannot build a healthy society without giving your citizens a sense of ownership. Otherwise, they will not share with you the responsibilities.
2082.author: Moza bint Nasser

2083.quote: There is this tremendous body of knowledge in the world of academia where extraordinary numbers of incredibly thoughtful people have taken the time to examine on a really profound level the way we live our lives and who we are and where we've been. That brilliant learning sometimes gets trapped in academia and never sees the light of day.
2083.author: Malcolm Gladwell

2084.quote: Nature is the source of all true knowledge. She has her own logic, her own laws, she has no effect without cause nor invention without necessity.
2084.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2085.quote: Probability is expectation founded upon partial knowledge. A perfect acquaintance with all the circumstances affecting the occurrence of an event would change expectation into certainty, and leave nether room nor demand for a theory of probabilities.
2085.author: George Boole

2086.quote: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
2086.author: William Cowper

2087.quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
2087.author: Albert Einstein

2088.quote: Knowledge is the parent of knowledge. He who possesses most of the information of his age will not quietly submit to neglect its current acquisitions, but will go on improving as long as means and opportunities offer; while he who finds himself ignorant of most things, is only too apt to shrink from a labour which becomes Herculean.
2088.author: James Fenimore Cooper

2089.quote: In 20 or 30 years, you'll be able to hold in your hand as much computing knowledge as exists now in the whole city, or even the whole world.
2089.author: Douglas Engelbart

2090.quote: In a knowledge economy, natural selection favors organizations that can most effectively harness and coordinate collective intellectual energy and creative capacity.
2090.author: Justin Rosenstein

2091.quote: Public schools helped create the idea of America and inculcate Americans with a few rudiments of knowledge. To judge by that very American item, the Internet, a few rudiments is all anyone cares to have.
2091.author: P. J. O'Rourke

2092.quote: Knowledge rests not upon truth alone, but upon error also.
2092.author: Carl Jung

2093.quote: When you know a thing, to hold that you know it, and when you do not know a thing, to allow that you do not know it - this is knowledge.
2093.author: Confucius

2094.quote: Knowledge is a polite word for dead but not buried imagination.
2094.author: e. e. cummings

2095.quote: Pain and foolishness lead to great bliss and complete knowledge, for Eternal Wisdom created nothing under the sun in vain.
2095.author: Khalil Gibran

2096.quote: The natural desire of good men is knowledge.
2096.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2097.quote: The knowledge of yourself will preserve you from vanity.
2097.author: Miguel de Cervantes

2098.quote: Having knowledge but lacking the power to express it clearly is no better than never having any ideas at all.
2098.author: Pericles

2099.quote: And what, Socrates, is the food of the soul? Surely, I said, knowledge is the food of the soul.
2099.author: Plato

2100.quote: Entire ignorance is not so terrible or extreme an evil, and is far from being the greatest of all; too much cleverness and too much learning, accompanied with ill bringing-up, are far more fatal.
2100.author: Plato

2101.quote: Knowledge is the eye of desire and can become the pilot of the soul.
2101.author: Will Durant

2102.quote: Cherish that which is within you, and shut off that which is without; for much knowledge is a curse.
2102.author: Zhuangzi

2103.quote: We are drowning in information but starved for knowledge.
2103.author: John Naisbitt

2104.quote: We live on an island surrounded by a sea of ignorance. As our island of knowledge grows, so does the shore of our ignorance.
2104.author: John Archibald Wheeler

2105.quote: I think we risk becoming the best informed society that has ever died of ignorance.
2105.author: Ruben Blades

2106.quote: We don't know all the answers. If we knew all the answers we'd be bored, wouldn't we? We keep looking, searching, trying to get more knowledge.
2106.author: Jack LaLanne

2107.quote: Knowledge is power only if man knows what facts not to bother with.
2107.author: Robert Staughton Lynd

2108.quote: The doorstep to the temple of wisdom is a knowledge of our own ignorance.
2108.author: Benjamin Franklin

2109.quote: Distinguishing the signal from the noise requires both scientific knowledge and self-knowledge.
2109.author: Nate Silver

2110.quote: Knowledge is power. Most of us agree that something has to be done to strengthen Social Security, and I believe it's irresponsible to arbitrarily dismiss any idea, Republican nor Democrat, without giving it a hard look.
2110.author: Conrad Burns

2111.quote: There is a general knowledge that I am multi-dimensional, that when you are creative you do a lot of things.
2111.author: Suzanne Somers

2112.quote: After the knowledge of, and obedience to, the will of God, the next aim must be to know something of His attributes of wisdom, power, and goodness as evidenced by His handiwork.
2112.author: James Prescott Joule

2113.quote: Because in the school of the Spirit man learns wisdom through humility, knowledge by forgetting, how to speak by silence, how to live by dying.
2113.author: Johannes Tauler

2114.quote: There's no such thing is aging, but maturing and knowledge. It's beautiful, I call that beauty.
2114.author: Celine Dion

2115.quote: The library, with its Daedalian labyrinth, mysterious hush, and faintly ominous aroma of knowledge, has been replaced by the computer's cheap glow, pesky chirp, and data spillage.
2115.author: P. J. O'Rourke

2116.quote: Life is a culmination of the past, an awareness of the present, an indication of a future beyond knowledge, the quality that gives a touch of divinity to matter.
2116.author: Charles Lindbergh

2117.quote: Zeal will do more than knowledge.
2117.author: William Hazlitt

2118.quote: It makes a great deal of difference whether one wills not to sin or has not the knowledge to sin.
2118.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

2119.quote: Lost wealth may be replaced by industry, lost knowledge by study, lost health by temperance or medicine, but lost time is gone forever.
2119.author: Samuel Smiles

2120.quote: Ignorance is bold and knowledge reserved.
2120.author: Thucydides

2121.quote: Knowledge cultivates your seeds and does not sow in your seeds.
2121.author: Khalil Gibran

2122.quote: The past is a source of knowledge, and the future is a source of hope. Love of the past implies faith in the future.
2122.author: Stephen Ambrose

2123.quote: We can't have full knowledge all at once. We must start by believing; then afterwards we may be led on to master the evidence for ourselves.
2123.author: Thomas Aquinas

2124.quote: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.
2124.author: Sidney Hook

2125.quote: It is a matter of common knowledge that the government of South Carolina is under domination of a small ring of cunning, conniving men.
2125.author: Strom Thurmond

2126.quote: To act on the belief that we possess the knowledge and the power which enable us to shape the processes of society entirely to our liking, knowledge which in fact we do not possess, is likely to make us do much harm.
2126.author: Friedrich August von Hayek

2127.quote: Scientific discovery and scientific knowledge have been achieved only by those who have gone in pursuit of it without any practical purpose whatsoever in view.
2127.author: Max Planck

2128.quote: Data is not information, information is not knowledge, knowledge is not understanding, understanding is not wisdom.
2128.author: Clifford Stoll

2129.quote: It may, however, be said that the level of experience to which concepts are inapplicable cannot yield any knowledge of a universal character, for concepts alone are capable of being socialized.
2129.author: Muhammad Iqbal

2130.quote: For whatever be the knowledge which we are able to obtain of God, either by perception or reflection, we must of necessity believe that He is by many degrees far better than what we perceive Him to be.
2130.author: Origen

2131.quote: At each increase of knowledge, as well as on the contrivance of every new tool, human labour becomes abridged.
2131.author: Charles Babbage

2132.quote: But the scientific importance of a change in knowledge of fact consists precisely in j its having consequences for a system of theory.
2132.author: Talcott Parsons

2133.quote: G is Grace, the Flaming Star is the Torch of Reason. Those who possess this knowledge are indeed Illuminati.
2133.author: Adam Weishaupt

2134.quote: I listen to them freely and with all the respect merited by their intelligence, their character, their knowledge, reserving always my incontestable right of criticism and censure.
2134.author: Mikhail Bakunin

2135.quote: When I severe my connections with the A.I.A. I do so with my own self respect, as a matter of pride and I am sure within your knowledge of my character.
2135.author: Ralph Thomas Walker

2136.quote: Prices are important not because money is considered paramount but because prices are a fast and effective conveyor of information through a vast society in which fragmented knowledge must be coordinated.
2136.author: Thomas Sowell

2137.quote: The education that prepared me was my general education classes, which I tried to avoid when I was a stupid undergraduate, but which gave me the foundation of general knowledge that makes a career as a writer possible.
2137.author: Orson Scott Card

2138.quote: Thought is the wind and knowledge the sail.
2138.author: David Hare

2139.quote: Our knowledge is a receding mirage in an expanding desert of ignorance.
2139.author: Will Durant

2140.quote: In complete darkness we are all the same, it is only our knowledge and wisdom that separates us, don't let your eyes deceive you.
2140.author: Janet Jackson

2141.quote: Scholastic learning and polemical divinity retarded the growth of all true knowledge.
2141.author: David Hume

2142.quote: Universities exist to transmit knowledge and understanding of ideas and values to students not to provide entertainment for spectators or employment for athletes.
2142.author: Milton Friedman

2143.quote: If a little knowledge was a dangerous thing, a lot was lethal.
2143.author: Tom Sharpe

2144.quote: When you deal with a person who's experiencing dementia, you can see where they're struggling with knowledge. You can see what they forget completely, what they forget but they know what they once knew. You can tell how they're trying to remember.
2144.author: Walter Mosley

2145.quote: The most important seed I can sow in this life is my children, and the love and knowledge that I can bestow upon them and the help I can give them.
2145.author: Steven Seagal

2146.quote: I think in the NFL knowledge is power, and you try to get the knowledge by whatever means.
2146.author: Steve Sabol

2147.quote: Compassion is a practically acquired knowledge, like dancing. You must do it and practice diligently day by day.
2147.author: Karen Armstrong

2148.quote: Imagine someone holding forth on biology whose only knowledge of the subject is 'The Book of British Birds,' and you have a rough idea of what it feels like to read Richard Dawkins on theology.
2148.author: Terry Eagleton

2149.quote: Is there anything science should not try to explain? Science is knowledge and knowledge is power - power to do good or evil. Sometimes ignorance is bliss.
2149.author: Paul Davies

2150.quote: The people I go after are the false experts, those who do not accept the limits of their knowledge.
2150.author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

2151.quote: Knowledge is not just the preserve of the educated elite. Just because someone has not had a formal education, that does not mean he does not have wisdom and common sense.
2151.author: Vikas Swarup

2152.quote: All knowledge which ends in words will die as quickly as it came to life, with the exception of the written word: which is its mechanical part.
2152.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2153.quote: I'd like to see people pay attention to the science of hip hop. The knowledge part, the political side of what hip hop could do, or where hip hop is gonna go. I always say it's gonna become universal as we become a galactic union.
2153.author: Afrika Bambaataa

2154.quote: You will always have partial points of view, and you'll always have the story behind the story that hasn't come out yet. And any form of journalism you're involved with is going to be up against a biased viewpoint and partial knowledge.
2154.author: Margaret Atwood

2155.quote: I have recently been able to see the new world - the quiet, the tranquility and the freedom it will bring with it. This is very comforting knowledge for me because I already know that what I envision eventually becomes a reality.
2155.author: Shari Arison

2156.quote: I don't claim to know everything. I claim to be a seeker of knowledge.
2156.author: Marie Osmond

2157.quote: Written in 1895, Alfred Nobel's will endowed prizes for scientific research in chemistry, physics, and medicine. At that time, these fields were narrowly defined, and researchers were often classically trained in only one discipline. In the late 19th century, knowledge of science was not a requisite for success in other walks of life.
2157.author: Peter Agre

2158.quote: Knowledge is knowing that a tomato is a fruit. Wisdom is knowing not to put it in a fruit salad.
2158.author: Brian O'Driscoll

2159.quote: I entreat masters to live a good life and faithfully to instruct their scholars, especially that they may love God and learn to give themselves to knowledge, in order to promote His honour, the welfare of the state, and their own salvation, but not for the sake of avarice or the praise of man.
2159.author: Jan Hus

2160.quote: Learn when and how to use different data structures and their algorithms in your own code. This is harder as a student, as the problem assignments you'll work through just won't impart this knowledge. That's fine.
2160.author: Robert Love

2161.quote: Of our relation to all creation we can never know anything whatsoever. All is immensity and chaos. But, since all this knowledge of our limitations cannot possibly be of any value to us, it is better to ignore it in our daily conduct of life.
2161.author: H. P. Lovecraft

2162.quote: What we want is to see the child in pursuit of knowledge, and not knowledge in pursuit of the child.
2162.author: George Bernard Shaw

2163.quote: Consider your origins: you were not made to live as brutes, but to follow virtue and knowledge.
2163.author: Dante Alighieri

2164.quote: We are here and it is now. Further than that, all human knowledge is moonshine.
2164.author: H. L. Mencken

2165.quote: When a man's knowledge is not in order, the more of it he has the greater will be his confusion.
2165.author: Herbert Spencer

2166.quote: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
2166.author: John Locke

2167.quote: No man's knowledge here can go beyond his experience.
2167.author: John Locke

2168.quote: Knowledge of the self is the mother of all knowledge. So it is incumbent on me to know my self, to know it completely, to know its minutiae, its characteristics, its subtleties, and its very atoms.
2168.author: Khalil Gibran

2169.quote: Perplexity is the beginning of knowledge.
2169.author: Khalil Gibran

2170.quote: No man can reveal to you nothing but that which already lies half-asleep in the dawning of your knowledge.
2170.author: Khalil Gibran

2171.quote: Our knowledge can only be finite, while our ignorance must necessarily be infinite.
2171.author: Karl Popper

2172.quote: Where there is shouting, there is no true knowledge.
2172.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2173.quote: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.
2173.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2174.quote: Knowledge of the past and of the places of the earth is the ornament and food of the mind of man.
2174.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2175.quote: The knower and the known are one. Simple people imagine that they should see God as if he stood there and they here. This is not so. God and I, we are one in knowledge.
2175.author: Meister Eckhart

2176.quote: Today knowledge has power. It controls access to opportunity and advancement.
2176.author: Peter Drucker

2177.quote: They say a little knowledge is a dangerous thing, but it's not one half so bad as a lot of ignorance.
2177.author: Terry Pratchett

2178.quote: Even the knowledge of my own fallibility cannot keep me from making mistakes. Only when I fall do I get up again.
2178.author: Vincent Van Gogh

2179.quote: The true method of knowledge is experiment.
2179.author: William Blake

2180.quote: The aim of education is the knowledge not of facts but of values.
2180.author: William Ralph Inge

2181.quote: Those people who develop the ability to continuously acquire new and better forms of knowledge that they can apply to their work and to their lives will be the movers and shakers in our society for the indefinite future.
2181.author: Brian Tracy

2182.quote: The knowledge I have now is not the knowledge I had then.
2182.author: Stokely Carmichael

2183.quote: One whose knowledge is confined to books and whose wealth is in the possession of others, can use neither his knowledge nor wealth when the need for them arises.
2183.author: Chanakya

2184.quote: Without knowledge action is useless and knowledge without action is futile.
2184.author: Abu Bakr
